column4: Say, all- I'm getting an error when I try to use an audio disk on my other computer. Says I need to run gst-register, but the commandline says that doesn't exist...
Say, all- I'm getting an error when I try to use an audio disk on my other computer. Says I need to run gst-register, but the commandline says that doesn't exist...
Ah! So I should just leave if no one notices my post, then?
No, but try to have enough patience to wait more than 2 minutes.
Meh, perhaps this is true. It is a busy chatroom.
Yeah, I can see something getting lost in the noise but your first message was still on the screen. :P
*blinks* Really? .... I should probably resize my window from standard :D
That'll make the chatroom a lot easy to understand, eh? ;)
Heya!!!! Sucess! Sound! My giant CD player works! (Ok, so I really want the other computer to do more than that, but right now it's just a CD player with VNC access :D
congrats, i'll file a bug report about the name issue
*blinks* Oh, was it really a name issue? 32bit ubuntu, breezy, if that helps any. Running on a stone age celeron.
The app told you to run gst-register but the program was called gst-register-0.8. That's the name issue. :)
Ahhh, true : ) It's curious that it asked me to do that, anyway. I don't remember that step on my laptop. Then again, I had to do so much funky stuff with the laptop, I may just have forgotten.
Ok, good. Now that we've got that step done, I just need to get NAT working....... *stares at the ipmasq man page* Oh, man.
what he said, i guess. I don't do NAT with a linux box.

Basically, I'm going to use the other box for skype while I play America's Army. I figure making the other box run skype through a nat is easier than recompiling the openal library on a 64 bit machine.... *grins*
